skill_content:
# Context7 Documentation Skill Use this skill when you need to fetch official, up-to-date documentation for libraries, frameworks, or programming tools. ## When to Use - Looking up API documentation for a library - Finding usage examples for a framework - Checking the latest syntax or features - Getting accurate, official documentation (not outdated training data) ## CLI Usage (Recommended) ### Step 1: Resolve Library ID First, find the Context7-compatible library ID: ```bash scooter call context7.resolve-library-id libraryName="" ``` **Example:** ```bash scooter call context7.resolve-library-id libraryName="react" # Returns: /websites/react_dev ``` ### Step 2: Get Documentation Fetch documentation for a specific topic: ```bash scooter call context7.get-library-docs context7CompatibleLibraryID="" topic="" ``` **Parameters:** - `context7CompatibleLibraryID` (required): The library ID from step 1 - `topic` (optional): Specific topic to focus on (e.g., "hooks", "routing", "state") - `tokens` (optional): Maximum tokens to return (default: 5000) ## Gateway Usage (MCP-native clients) 1. Activate the tool: ``` scooter_activate("context7") ``` 2. Resolve library: ``` resolve-library-id({libraryName: "react"}) ``` 3. Get docs: ``` get-library-docs({context7CompatibleLibraryID: "/websites/react_dev", topic: "hooks"}) ``` ## Examples | User Request | Commands | |--------------|----------| | "How do React hooks work?" | 1. `scooter call context7.resolve-library-id libraryName="react"`
2. `scooter call context7.get-library-docs context7CompatibleLibraryID="/websites/react_dev" topic="hooks"` | | "Next.js routing docs" | 1. `scooter call context7.resolve-library-id libraryName="nextjs"`
2. `scooter call context7.get-library-docs context7CompatibleLibraryID="/websites/nextjs_org" topic="routing"` | | "Tailwind CSS utilities" | 1. `scooter call context7.resolve-library-id libraryName="tailwindcss"`
2. `scooter call context7.get-library-docs context7CompatibleLibraryID="/websites/tailwindcss_com" topic="utilities"` | ## Supported Libraries Context7 supports most popular libraries and frameworks including: - React, Vue, Angular, Svelte - Next.js, Nuxt, Remix, Astro - Node.js, Deno, Bun - TypeScript, Python, Go, Rust - And many more... ## Tips - Always resolve the library ID first before fetching docs - Use specific topics to get focused documentation - Increase `tokens` parameter if you need more comprehensive docs
